tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: Doctor is very patient and gives good time to explain the problem and any queries. Some doctors get irritated when parents become impatient but this doctor was polite throughout. Clinic is well equipped with small lab for tests like CBP, crc etc and an onsite pharmacy. Available in evenings which helps to take appointment post office hours.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Doctor is polite, listens patiently and like to get good understanding before recommending medicines. I showed my son for chest congestion and breathing problems (snoring during night). He was able to diagnose the problems and provided suitable treatment with which, his breathing problem has been addressed to great degree and I am really thankful to Sir. I wish him all the very best!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Thanking Dr Janardan Reddy Garu for patiently listening our queries n explaining in detail (but understandable language for non-medico techie parents) about perrennial stomach pain my 7yrs old was complaining for almost 10 dayz. Kid got relieved shortly...

Worth commendable referral for pediatrics near Aparna Cyberzon, Nallagandla.

Though not utilized in our case, they have MD Medicine and inhouse Path Lab. 

Rgds SachinM
reply_text: Thanq so much for your kind words, we are here for better health of our community

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: I have visited this clinic twice for my son viral fever.. First time the doctor didn't even check my son's body temperature. Second time he asked to get segue test done at his clinic. Which we got it done. thank God it was negetive. Though we told the doctor that my son's body temperature is high and it's fluctuating, He didn't prescribe anything other than crocin. The same night I had to take him to a different doctor and he pricribed a different medicine. ***** ******* ********** **** **** ** **** *******
reply_text: For viral fever no antibiotic will work and Crocin will help to reduce fever and  viral fever takes  3 to 4 to settle down and tell that medicine I will also prescribe which will work like magic drug , giving negative feedback is very easy rather than understanding the problem for you

review: Doctor was very nice considering the spoilt child. He made the child very comfortable and she did not know whether Elsie was accessed by doctor.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Time is valuable especially when its come to your child health...only investigation for a week with no results is not we expect from such a responsible person like doctor. I think its only due to hospital policies.
reply_text: Hi, it seems to be your child got viral infection, first ur kid visited with complaints fever, rash over body, body pains as far as i remembered, examination was normal, I was suggested CBP, CRP, dengue test were normal. Again u came with   Persistent fever spikes and with increased cough and cold , on examination she had slightly decreased breath sounds on right infrascapular area and I advised chest X-ray to rule out pneumonia.It suggestive of viral picture. If I ordered investigations for money , I would have been advised admission after 1 week of fever but apparently she is active and eating well , so I advised oral medications along with antibiotic. The crux here is antibiotic will not work for viral infections and I am a human being and will not diagnose everything by examination itself and without investigations. Think twice before giving negative feedback as it is easy to do .Anyway I wish speedy recovery of your kid in the hands of responsible doctor   Thank you
